text: we've had a number of people raised the
question well why not just use the
online times and our argument is that
having the the printed times is so
important because you see the
relationship of the articles one to the
other the relationship of the photo to
the article the headlines very recently
we looked at an environmental article
that talked about power generating
plants Cole fed plants in Texas and it
was interesting to see that article next
to something that that talked about
energy conservation so the relationship
is very important having all on access
allows our students to go and do more
in-depth research on a topic whereas
getting daily printed paper it gives
them a nice purview of what's happening
in the world I use the print version and
the web version because people do read
on the web these days and it's fruitless
to think that you're only going to get
them to read the print version so I
liked them to see the distinction well I
prefer to have students have the paper
in hand rather than see it online
because they can view they can flip
through it much more easily and pick out
things that are interest to them it also
makes it more possible to have small
groups choose an article right then and
there in the classroom and read it
together and discuss it for me I want
them to have the hard copy because it's
the things they're not looking for that
are going to really educate them and so
when you're just hanging out reading the
paper you might find an article that you
never would have learned anything about
and I don't know I don't always tell
them what they have to be reading I
don't care what they read they can read
the sports section they can read the
business section they can read a you
know the Metro section any of it is fine
with me as long as there's something in
they're that they can understand relates
to sociology and all of it does
you
